usefulItems: 2 x 6 hole doughnut tins (Ø 8 cm), wire rack, pastry brush, oven
title: Baked Doughnuts

ingredients.content: 35 g olive oil, plus extra for greasing

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 170°C and grease 2 x 6-hole doughnut tins.
Place flour, sugar, baking powder, bicarbonate of soda and salt in mixing bowl then mix <b>5 sec/speed 3<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place egg, vanilla extract, yoghurt, milk and oil in mixing bowl then mix <b>5 sec/speed 4<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add reserved flour mixture and mix <b>7 sec/speed 4<b>. Finish mixing by hand with spatula if necessary. Divide between prepared doughnut holes up to ⅔ full. Bake for 10-12 minutes (170°C) until cooked and golden.
Leave to cool in tins for a few minutes, then loosen with a knife and carefully remove to a wire rack. Meanwhile, make topping.
Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid then weigh in sugar and add cinnamon. Remove from lid and stir until combined. Brush melted butter onto curved side of doughnuts then dip in cinnamon sugar mixture.
Serve warm or at room temperature.
